channel.title: CVE Feed for Apple -- Safari
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Apple -- Safari

item.title: CVE-2023-42917|2023-11-30T22:18:50.340Z -- apple -- safari
item.description: A memory corruption vulnerability was addressed with improved locking. This issue is fixed in iOS 17.1.2 and iPadOS 17.1.2, macOS Sonoma 14.1.2, Safari 17.1.2. Processing web content may lead to arbitrary code execution. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been exploited against versions of iOS before iOS 16.7.1.

item.title: CVE-2023-42890|2023-12-12T00:27:26.197Z -- apple -- safari
item.description: The issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in Safari 17.2, macOS Sonoma 14.2, watchOS 10.2, iOS 17.2 and iPadOS 17.2, tvOS 17.2. Processing web content may lead to arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2023-42883|2023-12-12T00:27:16.184Z -- apple -- safari
item.description: The issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in Safari 17.2, macOS Sonoma 14.2, iOS 17.2 and iPadOS 17.2, watchOS 10.2, tvOS 17.2, iOS 16.7.3 and iPadOS 16.7.3. Processing an image may lead to a denial-of-service.

item.title: CVE-2023-42916|2023-11-30T22:18:49.672Z -- apple -- safari
item.description: An out-of-bounds read was addressed with improved input validation. This issue is fixed in iOS 17.1.2 and iPadOS 17.1.2, macOS Sonoma 14.1.2, Safari 17.1.2. Processing web content may disclose sensitive information. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been exploited against versions of iOS before iOS 16.7.1.

item.title: CVE-2023-42956|2024-03-28T15:39:18.246Z -- apple -- safari
item.description: The issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in Safari 17.2, iOS 17.2 and iPadOS 17.2, macOS Sonoma 14.2. Processing web content may lead to a denial-of-service.

item.title: CVE-2023-42866|2024-01-10T22:03:15.576Z -- apple -- safari
item.description: The issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in macOS Ventura 13.5, iOS 16.6 and iPadOS 16.6, tvOS 16.6, Safari 16.6, watchOS 9.6. Processing web content may lead to arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2023-42950|2024-03-28T15:39:16.227Z -- apple -- safari
item.description: A use after free issue was addressed with improved memory management. This issue is fixed in Safari 17.2, iOS 17.2 and iPadOS 17.2, tvOS 17.2, watchOS 10.2, macOS Sonoma 14.2. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2023-42956|2024-06-04T17:25:40.331Z -- apple -- safari
item.description: The issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in Safari 17.2, iOS 17.2 and iPadOS 17.2, macOS Sonoma 14.2. Processing web content may lead to a denial-of-service.
